Specific Details: Parliamentary Question Request - Why is State not funding intepreters for GPs when seeing Roma people who do not speak English.
DPOs Lobbied: Chris Andrews|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Parliamentary Question Request - Why is State not funding intepreters for GPs when seeing Roma people who do not speak English.
Intended Results: Answer to Question in Parliament.
Lobbying Activities:
Evidence is emerging that the Roma population in Ireland are being disproportionately affected by Covid 19, more than any other vulnerable group.  Many of them do not speak English.

Why is the State still not funding  interpreters for GPs when seeing Roma people who do not speak English, so that they can access the healthcare to which they are entitled, and which would be in the public interest? 

This despite Ireland's National Traveller and Roma Integration strategy, and 500 million euro funding from the EU for Social Inclusion in the past 6 years.

There are estimated to be up to 5000 Roma people living in Ireland.|Email|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Dr Angela Skuce, Medical Director, Safetynet Primary Care

Lobbyist Name: Irish National Organisation of the Unemployed
Specific Details: The INOU attended a meeting with Violet Ann Wynn, TD and a Dáil debate on Sinn Fein's Private Members bill seeking to redress the serious gap in Ireland's equality legislation - the lack of a ground covering socio-economic status; and issued a call to all TDs to address this issue in the subsequent Dáil vote.
DPOs Lobbied: Violet Anne Wynne|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Chris Andrews|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The INOU attended a meeting with Violet Ann Wynn, TD and a Dáil debate on Sinn Fein's Private Members bill seeking to redress the serious gap in Ireland's equality legislation - the lack of a ground covering socio-economic status; and issued a call to all TDs to address this issue in the subsequent Dáil vote.
Intended Results: To support the inclusion of socio-economic status as a new ground into Ireland's equality legislation as a matter of urgency, starting with a vote for the Equality (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill 2021.
Lobbying Activities: The INOU attended a meeting with Violet Ann Wynn, TD to discuss the Equality (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill 2021 and courtesy of Chris Andrews, TD attended a Dáil debate on this bill which seeks to redress the serious gap in Ireland's equality legislation - the lack of a ground covering socio-economic status. |Meeting|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Bríd O'Brien, Head of Policy and Media
